are live collections. They are up-to-date all the time and they will never contain an invalid
. Its size and elements order stay the same as the original collection's when it was created.

will always work. You can delete or modify the elements without impacting the iterator. See below example:

An iterator created from a live collection will create a stable view when the iterator is created, allowing you to delete and modify elements while iterating without impacting the iterator. However, the
backing the iterator will still be live updated meaning that size and order of elements can change when iterating.

Gets the first object from the collection.

Sorts a collection based on the provided field in ascending order.
Sorts a collection based on the provided field and sort order.

Deletes the object at the given index from the Realm.
Deletes the first object from the Realm.
Deletes the last object from the Realm.
Gets the first object from the collection.
Gets the first object from the collection. If the collection is empty, the provided default will be used instead.
Gets the last object from the collection.
Gets the last object from the collection. If the collection is empty, the provided default will be used instead.
Sorts a collection based on the provided field in ascending order.
the field name to sort by. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
Sorts a collection based on the provided field and sort order.
the field name to sort by. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
Sorts a collection based on the provided fields and sort orders.
first field name. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
second field name. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
Sorts a collection based on the provided fields and sort orders.
an array of field names to sort by. Only fields of type boolean, short, int, long, float, double, Date, and String are supported.
Deletes the object at the given index from the Realm. This also removes it from the collection.
the array index identifying the object to be removed.
Deletes the first object from the Realm. This also removes it from this collection.
Deletes the last object from the Realm. This also removes it from this collection.
